Module chav1961.purelib

Package chav1961.purelib.basic.growablearrays

This package contains a set of growable arrays for all primitive types.

Using of these arrays excludes wraping/unwrapping for primitive data, radically reduces memory requirements and speed up performance

All classes in the package have similar set of constructors and methods (differs with the type of primitive data only). All classes in the package use two models to keep data:

  • plain model - contiguous array of the data, that grows twice on overflow and shrinks twice or truncation (the same as in the ByteArrayOutputStream)
  • sliced model - two-dimensional array ('root'), that has 'leafs' with identical size

The first model guarantees maximal speed for inserting and reading, but can duplicate memory requirements to store data. The second one restricts memory requirements with the one empty 'leaf' in worst case, but slows a bit down performance.

To exclude extra moving data and allocating memory, all these classes allow direct access to their internal arrays, so they are not immutable. Method toArray() for all these classes allow access to 'raw' data, without cloning them. Length of returned array in almost all cases will be greater than really used, so always use only length() method in these classes instead of using array.length directly!

A specific method length(int) is now available in all the classes since 0.0.2. It can be used to expand or shrink array content. When array is expanding, the content of space appended is unpredicatable in general. To initialize it, you can use toArray() method of all the classes to get direct access to their's internal buffer.

Two classes in the package have a special children:

  • InOutGrowableByteArray - growable byte array, supporting advanced I/O functionality
  • InOutGrowableCharArray - growable character array, supporting advanced I/O functionality

To increase performance, it's strongly recommended to use GrowableCharArray instead of StringBuilder in Java 9 and higher, because of changes in the internal string representation in the standard JRE

All the classes in the package are not thread-safe

Since:
0.0.1
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
LastUpdate:
0.0.4
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    GrowableBooleanArray
    This class implements functionality for the growable boolean arrays.
    GrowableByteArray
    This class implements functionality for the growable byte arrays.
    GrowableCharArray<T extends GrowableCharArray<?>>
    This class implements functionality for the growable character arrays.
    GrowableDoubleArray
    This class implements functionality for the growable double arrays.
    GrowableFloatArray
    This class implements functionality for the growable float arrays.
    GrowableIntArray
    This class implements functionality for the growable int arrays.
    GrowableLongArray
    This class implements functionality for the growable long arrays.
    GrowableShortArray
    This class implements functionality for the growable short arrays.
    InOutGrowableByteArray
    This class extends functionality of GrowableByteArray with different I/O-styled operations.
    InOutGrowableCharArray
    This class implements CharStreamPrinter interface for GrowableCharArray class.
